It was still tedious having to switch boots and float/sink constantly though.

author: Jeremy Sieracki

text: Btw, The reason that people had trouble with this dungeon is a simple fact, When the game was first released, you could flip a switch out of order and not be able to finish it. YOu then had to restart your game over in order to get passed the temple, the entire game over.  A week after its relese they game was altered in the later ones that were put out on the shelves... allowing the temple to not be soo "INSANE"

The Majora's Mask water temple is a bitch, but this one's not bad at all.

text: It toke me HOURS to get pass this damn temple. Never used any guide, this temple is all about trial and error.

text: Its the fact that you have to take the boots off and put them back off in a process in which you must go to the main menu, press them, wait 5 seconds, choose save/dont save do what you have to do with them, then repeat 12314332 times for the next sixteen hours
author: Evilknightz

text: All I've been able to consume today is water...because I ate some bad meat yesterday.
author: Sephiko

text: Damn I hated the Water Temple as a kid. The music however is quite fitting for the dungeon.
author: GameBeatenakaKevinS

text:
Nah, to me, the Shadow Temple was just annoying, but it wasn't as bad as the Water Temple in terms of difficulty.

And if you want a Nintendo that can give you a good scare instead of just one temple in a game, try Eternal Darkness.
author: Kojou Akatsuki

text: This temple was a pain in the ass, but i honestly thought the Shadow temple was worse. Maybe because i was 9-ish when i played it and the shadow temple just scared the hell out of me, but i thought that was far more frustrating.

text: I dont see why everyone hated this temple. Alongside Forest Temple, it's probably one of the most atmospheric dungeons in the game. And it wasnt THAT hard!

text: The infamous Water Temple. I have to say, for some reason, I never had that much trouble with this dungeon even the first time I played. It was a really memorable temple though, I'll always remember the giant room with a small tree where you fight the fake Link.
